description: Venezuela is on edge even after the removal of Nicolás Maduro and the swearing in of Delcy Rodríguez as acting president. Military intelligence patrols and armed gangs are out on the streets of Caracas. Bloomberg's Crayton Harrison reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Caracas Residents on Edge After Maduro Arrest

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Hilton Hotels said one of its Hampton Inn operators had apologized for an incident in which reservations for Department of Homeland Security agents traveling to Minnesota were cancelled.
title: Hilton Says Minnesota Hotel Apologized Over Cancelled DHS Rooms

description: Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty to US charges in a narco-terrorism case against him, saying "I am innocent" and "I am not guilty" through an interpreter. Maduro's wife also pleaded not guilty. They're both being held without bail. Bloomberg's Myles Miller reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Maduro Tells US Federal Court 'I Am Innocent'

author: Brian Platt
description: Chrystia Freeland, the first woman to be Canada’s finance minister, said she’ll resign her seat in Parliament in the coming weeks after being named an economic adviser to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
title: Freeland to Resign from Canada’s Parliament for New Ukraine Role

author: Nathan R Dean
description: The US military operation puts other nations on notice.
title: Assessing the Aftermath of Trump’s Venezuela Intervention

description:
After striking Venezuela, the US president signaled he’ll apply his foreign policy approach elsewhere, speculating about Cuba and Greenland as places he wants to “help.”
Rockford Weitz from Tufts University Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to explain. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump's Maduro Ouster Shows His New World Order is Here

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss US oil stocks rallying as President Trump vows a Venezuelan revival following Nicolas Maduro's ouster. Bloomberg's Devika Krishna Kumar joins the show to break it down. Also on today's show, Rice University's Baker Institute for Public Policy Fellow Francisco Monaldi on Delcy Rodriguez being sworn in as acting president of Venezuela, and Tufts university Maritime Studies Program Director Rockford Weitz talks Trump's new world order following Maduro's capture. Plus, PGIM Managing Director and Executive Portfolio Advisor Michael Collins discusses Venezuela bond traders betting on more gains as emerging markets assets become more desirable. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Oil Stocks Rally After Maduro Ouster | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 1/5/2025

description: Bloomberg's Devika Krishna Kumar breaks down the high cost of rebuilding Venezuela's oil infrastructure and the part that oil companies are expected to play in the fallout from the Trump administration's arrest of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump’s Energy Boss to Meet with Oil Companies on Venezuela

description: Venezuela’s National Assembly inaugurated Delcy Rodríguez as acting president on Monday, an overt signal that she’s won the regime’s blessing for her political takeover despite her conciliatory gestures to the US. (Translation via AP) (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Venezuela Swears In Rodríguez As Acting President

description: The US ambassador to the UN, Mike Waltz, said the US is not occupying Venezuela, calling the special forces raid that captured Nicolas Maduro a "law enforcement operation." He spoke during an emergency meeting of the Security Council. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Does Not Want to Occupy Venezuela, Waltz Says

description: Heather Conley, nonresident Senior Fellow at the American Enterprise Institute, says that while Greenland is in a key position for European and US national security, the Trump administration should focus on working with Greenland, Denmark and other European partners to sure up that security instead of making threats to take it over.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Denmark Pushes Back on Trump's Renewed Greenland Threats

description:
Venezuelan bonds are poised to gain after the US captured President Nicolás Maduro, setting the stage for potential regime change.
The prospect of a potential debt restructuring could fuel further gains, although a resolution for Venezuelan debt could prove tricky, with the country having to unwind a web of defaulted bonds, loans and legal judgments owed to creditors. PGIM Managing Director and Executive Portfolio Advisor Michael Collins joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Markets 'Whistling Past Graveyard' on Venezuela, Says PGIM's Collins

author: Ellen Milligan
description: UK Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper said she raised the importance of complying with international law with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, following the American removal of Nicolás Maduro from Venezuela.
title: UK Urges US to Comply With International Law on Venezuela

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondents Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall discuss the latest developments from Venezuela. On today's show, Center for Strategic and International Studies Senior Associate Eric Farnsworth, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino and American Enterprise Institute Nonresident Senior Fellow Heather Conley. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Eyes Venezuela Oil Control | Balance of Power: Early Edition 1/5/2025

description: Robert McWhirter, an expert in constitutional law, says that the legal proceedings against Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro could take years and that the case brought against him by the US Department of Justice raises many questions of international law.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Maduro Legal Battle Could Take Years, Says Constitutional Lawyer

description: Eric Farnsworth, a former State Department official, said given the damage that's been done to the Venezuelan economy over the past 26 years rebuilding the country and will take considerable time.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Rebuilding Venezuela Infrastructure Will Take 'A Lot of Time,' Says Farnsworth

description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests: University of Denver Professor Francisco Rodriguez and Crossmark Global Investments Chief Market Strategist Victoria Fernandez.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Maduro Pleads Not Guilty, US Oil Stocks Jump After Maduro Capture | Bloomberg Markets 1/5/2026

author: Michael Smith
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis wants to build more detention camps after local cops made 20,000 immigration-related arrests in less than a year, giving the state an out-sized role in President Donald Trump’s deportation dragnet.
title: Florida Plans More Immigrant Camps After Making 20,000 Arrests

author: Jessica Nix
description: The US Department of Health and Human Services is changing its recommendations for the childhood vaccine schedule by no longer broadly endorsing influenza, Covid-19 and other once-routine immunizations.
title: US Changes Child Vaccine Schedule to Call for Fewer Shots

author: Fareed Sahloul
description: AI, Mega deals, PE, Trump and the once and future energy surge
title: Five Big M&A Trends to Track in 2026

author: Robert Tuttle
description: The shocking capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro over the weekend by US forces is already reverberating across the oil market in the Americas, particularly Canada.
title: Canadian Heavy Crude Prices Weaken After Overthrow of Maduro

author: Alex Wickham, Andrea Palasciano, Alberto Nardelli
description: European leaders and US officials aim to finalize an agreement on security guarantees that include the possibility of American boots on the ground in postwar Ukraine in a bid to ensure that any peace deal endures.
title: Ukraine’s Allies Aim to Secure US Offer to Deploy Troops Postwar

description:
Ousted Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty on Monday to US charges in a narco-terrorism case against him, kicking off an extraordinary legal battle with major geopolitical ramifications.  
“I am innocent,” Maduro said through an interpreter. “I am a decent man,” adding that he is the president of his country.  Bloomberg's Myles Miller reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Maduro Pleads Not Guilty in Narco-Terrorism Case in US Court

description: "Bloomberg ETF IQ" focuses on the opportunities, risks and current trends tied to the trillions of dollars in the global exchange traded funds industry. Today's guests: Discipline Funds Founder Cullen Roche and Stone Harbor Investment Partners CIO and Head of EM Jim Craige.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Impact of Geopolitical Risks, Maduro Pleads Not Guilty To All Charges | ETF IQ 1/5/2026

description:
America’s allies offered a measured response after US troops captured Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro in a raid, a move that sent shockwaves around the world and highlighted divisions among governments.
In Asia, Japan, South Korea, Australia and Thailand avoided condemning the move, instead emphasizing diplomacy, dialogue and stability. The Philippines went slightly further, pointing to Washington’s “underlying security considerations,” while also urging all parties to respect international law. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: World Powers Could Follow The US's Lead After Venezuela Says Price

description:
US stocks rose on Monday, with the Nasdaq 100 Index and the S&P 500 Index gaining, as demand for tech shares remained strong despite worries over geopolitical risk.
Oil prices and gold rose, with Brent crude and gold prices increasing as oil traders weighed the fallout from the developments in Caracas and investors sought safe-haven assets.
 Peter Tchir, Head of Macro Strategy at Academy Securities, joins Paul Sweeney and Scarlet Fu to discuss impact of Venezuela attack on markets. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Stocks Rise as Traders Shrug Off Maduro Ouster

author: Ari Natter
description: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright plans to talk this week with oil-industry executives about reviving Venezuela’s energy sector following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: US to Meet With Oil Executives This Week on Venezuela Revival

description: Ousted Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty to US charges in a narco-terrorism case against him on Monday. Maduro’s wife, Cilia Flores, who was also in court in front of a federal judge in Lower Manhattan, pleaded not guilty to the three charges she faces. Myles Miller reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Maduro Pleads Not Guilty to US Charges in Narco-Terrorism Case

author: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago
description: Nicolás Maduro’s son said he would “unconditionally support” Delcy Rodríguez, who has been declared acting president of Venezuela after his father was captured by the US and flown out of the country.
title: Maduro’s Son Backs Rodríguez Even as She Extends Hand to Trump

description:
In the aftermath of the stunning late night operation that saw Maduro and his wife whisked from a guarded military base near Caracas to a New York jail, Trump demonstrated just how far the US is willing to go to eliminate a leader seen as a threat to American interests and security. 

 The US raid that captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro put America’s allies and adversaries on notice: President Donald Trump has a new world order of his own.
In the aftermath of the stunning late night operation that saw Maduro and his wife whisked from a guarded military base near Caracas to a New York jail, Trump demonstrated just how far the US is willing to go to eliminate a leader seen as a threat to American interests and security.  Aaron David Miller, Senior Fellow at Carnegie Endowment for International Peace joins to discuss on Bloomberg Intelligence. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Seizes Maduro as Trump Vows to 'Run' Venezuela

author: Jacob Reid
description: Less than 18 months after losing most of their House of Commons seats in the UK general election, the Scottish Nationalist Party is on the march again north of the English border.
title: Scottish Nationalists Start Comeback Bid Versus Weakened Starmer

author: Bob Van Voris, David Voreacos
description: Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty on Monday to US charges in a narco-terrorism case against him just two days after the US captured him in Caracas during a nighttime raid.
title: Maduro Pleads Not Guilty in Narco-Terrorism Case in US Court

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz dismissed one of his closest advisers, Chief of Staff Jacob Schrot, after a rocky eight months in office marked by tactical missteps and controversial statements.
title: Germany’s Merz Dismisses Chief of Staff After Series of Blunders

author: Allyson Versprille
description: The US Transportation Department wants to relax the ways it holds airlines and ticket agents accountable for violating consumer protection and civil rights laws.
title: US Aims to Ease Enforcement of Airline Consumer Protection Rules

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Russia is intensifying covert attacks on key infrastructure in Germany in a campaign of hybrid warfare that Berlin views as a possible prelude to a wider conflict, according to a military document obtained by Bloomberg.
title: Germany Sees Russian Covert Attacks as Prelude to Wider Conflict

author: Courtney McBride
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced plans to cut Senator Mark Kelly’s military rank and dock his pension over a video in which the Arizona lawmaker reminded servicemembers of their duty to disobey unlawful orders.
title: Hegseth Moves to Censure Kelly Over ‘Unlawful Orders’ Video

author: Benjamin Penn, Eric Killelea
description: Ousted Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro has hired prominent criminal defense lawyer Barry Pollack, who long represented Wikileaks founder Julian Assange, as his counsel in Manhattan criminal proceedings.
title: Nicolás Maduro Hires Assange Lawyer for Criminal Defense

author: Sanne Wass
description: Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said that if Donald Trump were to attack the Danish island of Greenland that would mean the end of the NATO alliance.
title: Denmark Says US Attack on Greenland Would Mean End of NATO

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: At least four oil tankers — and maybe as many as 16 — got through a US blockade on sanctioned vessels moving oil from Venezuela since the capture on Saturday of the Latin American country’s president Nicolas Maduro, according to TankerTrackers.com.
title: Venezuela Oil Blockade Dodged by Sanctioned Ships, Tracker Says

description: Former US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross, chair and CEO of Ross Acquisition Corp II, says "there's a lot of stuff that can be improved" in Venezuela after the capture of President Nicolas Maduro. Speaking on "Bloomberg Open Interest," Ross also discusses what the change in Venezuela's government could mean for oil markets. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Wilbur Ross Says Venezuela's Economy Needs to Change

description:
After the extraordinary US raid on Venezuela, is Greenland Donald Trump's next target?

Sanne Wass explains. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: After Venezuela Is Greenland Trump’s Next Target?

author: Alex Vasquez
description: President Claudia Sheinbaum downplayed Donald Trump’s threat to invade Mexico, and reiterated her rejection of a US military presence in her country.
title: Sheinbaum Says Trump’s Threats to Invade Mexico Aren’t Serious

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: A top United Nations official condemned the US attack on Venezuela, saying it violated international law, could fuel instability in the region and sets a concerning precedent that could make violent conflicts more likely.
title: UN Says US Raid on Venezuela Violated International Law

description: Nicolás Maduro is scheduled to have his first court appearance in Manhattan today. This is video of the ousted Venezuelan leader being taken from a detention center in Brooklyn to the court building in Lower Manhattan under heavy security. Maduro's wife is also in court. He could face life in prison if convicted. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Venezuela's Maduro on the Move in New York City

description: Venezuela President Nicolas Maduro speaks exclusively with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker. Maduro discusses relations with the U.S., Venezuela's economic and political outlook, and the challenges of rebuilding the nation's oil industry in the wake of stringent sanctions. (This report is in Spanish with English subtitles.) (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Nicolas Maduro Exclusive Interview

author: Enda Curran
description: After a year of rolling policy shocks, the US economy is set to get a lift from President Donald Trump’s tax-cuts package to keep the expansion on track in 2026.
title: Trump’s Tax Stimulus Set to Keep US Economy on Track in 2026

description: Nicolás Maduro is in Manhattan today for his first court date after US forces took him from his presidential compound in Venezuela over the weekend. His wife is also in court. Maduro could spend the rest of his life behind bars if convicted on several drug charges. Bloomberg's Tyler Kendall and Myles Miller report. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Venezuela's Maduro Due in NYC Court Today

author: Miranda Davis
description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz said he won’t seek reelection after coming under fire for a scandal involving alleged fraud in state programs, with many of the defendants Somali immigrants.
title: Minnesota Governor Walz Won’t Seek Reelection After Scandal

author: Sanne Wass, Andrea Palasciano, Arne Delfs, Will Standring
description: European officials pledged to support Greenland after US President Donald Trump restarted his campaign to take the self-governed island in the wake of his strike on Venezuela.
title: Europe Backs Greenland After Trump Resumes Takeover Threats

author: Firat Kozok
description: Turkey plans to reduce state contributions to private pensions totaling 2 trillion liras ($46 billion), according to officials familiar with the matter, as it seeks to rein in spending and narrow the budget deficit.
title: Turkey’s $46 Billion Pension Plans Set for Lower State Support

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: Legislation would place guardrails on artificial intelligence, even as its importance to the state economy grows.
title: AI Regulation Battle Looms in California Despite Trump Threats

author: Caitlin Reilly, Daniel Flatley
description: The US and more than 100 other countries finalized an agreement that would exempt American companies from some foreign taxes, the culmination of a months-long effort to create a carve-out from a corporate global minimum levy.
title: OECD Finalizes Agreement on Global Minimum Tax

author: Isabel Demetz, Paula Doenecke
description: The Swiss government has frozen any assets held in Switzerland by Nicolas Maduro and people close to the Venezuelan president.
title: Switzerland Freezes Assets of Maduro and People Close to Him

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he’s not planning a transition to a presidential system ahead of parliamentary elections expected in April.
title: Orban Says He Doesn’t Plan Presidential System Switch in Hungary

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping and South Korean leader Lee Jae Myung reaffirmed bilateral ties at their second meeting in two months, signaling efforts by both sides to stabilize relations as geopolitical tensions mount.
title: Xi and Lee Reaffirm China-Korea Ties at Second Summit in Two Months

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada’s industry minister is planning to meet with executives at Lockheed Martin Corp. soon to try to leverage more jobs out of a multibillion-dollar deal to acquire fighter jets.
title: Canada’s Joly Presses Lockheed for Jobs as Crucial F-35 Decision Nears

author: Nectar Gan
description: Donald Trump’s surprise attack on Venezuela has generated debate over whether the US leader set a precedent for Xi Jinping to undertake a similar strike in Taiwan. Either way, the stakes for Beijing are far higher.
title: Xi Faces Higher Costs in Taiwan Than Trump Does in Venezuela

author: Alan Crawford
description: The global fallout from America’s toppling of the Venezuelan president will be felt for years.
title: World Braces for Impact of Trump’s New Doctrine

author: Aaron Eglitis
description: Latvian authorities said a ship boarded by police on Sunday was likely not responsible for damage to an undersea telecommunication cable, as initially suspected.
title: Latvia Says Suspected Ship Likely Not Linked to Cable Damage

description: President Donald Trump said the US needs "total access" to Venezuela as questions mount about the country's leadership following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro.Trump said the US will work with acting President Delcy Rodríguez but said he hadn't spoken to her. "We're in charge," he said. On elections in the short term, he said, "Well, it depends," before adding, "We have to do one thing in Venezuela — bring it back." Trump's assertion that the US was in charge in Venezuela came after Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on a series of Sunday television shows that the US was focusing on the oil industry and watching for signs of opposition to US policies in Rodriguez's government.  Christopher Sabatini, Senior Research Fellow for Latin America, the US and North America at Chatham House joined Caroline Hepker and Lizzy Burden to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: 'No Legal Justification' For Venezuela Raid Says Christopher Sabatini

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: America’s allies offered a measured response after US troops captured Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro in a raid, a move that sent shockwaves around the world and highlighted divisions among governments.
title: US Allies Offer Muted Response After Trump’s Raid in Venezuela

author: Firat Kozok
description: Highlights from written responses by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan to Bloomberg, shortened and lightly edited for clarity and readability. The president referred to his country as Türkiye throughout, using the official name Turkey adopted in 2022.
title: Turkish President Erdogan Answers Questions on Energy, Defense, Gaza

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian prosecutors opened proceedings in a graft trial against former education minister Nadiem Makarim over the procurement of Chromebooks for use in schools, alleging the project caused 2.1 trillion rupiah ($125 million) in state losses.
title: Indonesia Tries Ex-Minister Makarim in Chromebook Graft Case

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, acting Venezuelan President Delcy Rodríguez invited the US to work with the country in a "balanced and respectful" relationship. Donald Trump said Washington would cooperate but needs “total access” to the South American country, saying “we’re in charge.”

US Secretary Marco Rubio says the US will use oil leverage to press for further change in Venezuela as he seeks to reshape Latin America in Washington’s favor.

Oil fluctuated as traders weighed the impact of the US raid on global supply. Gold and silver surged. Asian shares rose to a record.

Today's guests: Council on Foreign Relations Fellow Roxanna Vigil. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US-Venezuela Latest: Trump’s ‘Access’ Demand, Maduro to Appear in Court | Daybreak Europe 1/5/2026

description: President Donald Trump said the US needs “total access” to Venezuela as questions mount about the country’s leadership following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro. “We need total access. We need access to oil and to other things in their country that will allow us to rebuild their country,” Trump told reporters on Air Force One Sunday as he returned to Washington from spending the holidays at his Palm Beach estate. Trump said the US will work with acting President Delcy Rodríguez but said he hadn’t spoken to her. “We’re in charge,” he said. On elections in the short term, he said, “Well, it depends,” before adding, “We have to do one thing in Venezuela — bring it back.” (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump: US Needs ‘Total Access’ to Venezuela

author: Cao Ban
description: Vietnam welcomed a record number of foreign tourists in 2025, as a resurgence of Chinese visitors and relaxed visa policies helped lure travelers.
title: China’s Travelers Pivot to Vietnam, Driving Record Arrivals

author: Dana Khraiche
description: Saudi Arabia-backed forces in Yemen regained control of the strategic region of Hadramout over the weekend, following days of clashes with secessionist groups aligned with the United Arab Emirates.
title: Saudi-Backed Forces Regain Control of Strategic Yemeni Region

author: Firat Kozok
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan called for Turkey’s re-entry into the US-led F-35 fighter jet-program, saying it would help cement ties with Washington and strengthen the security of NATO.
title: Erdogan Says Turkish Return to F-35 Program Key to NATO Security

description: President Donald Trump said US oil companies will spend billions of dollars to rebuild Venezuela’s energy infrastructure after the capture of Nicolás Maduro, the country’s former leader. The nation has the world’s largest oil reserves, but output plummeted during Maduro’s 12-year term. Trump’s plan for a US-led revival of Venezuela’s oil industry could be a years-long and challenging process. Bloomberg Intelligence’s Salih Yilmaz breaks down the situation.
title: Is Trump’s Venezuela Oil Plan a $100 Billion Gamble?

description: Oil fluctuated as investors weighed the fallout from the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro by US forces on global crude supply and its wider impact on the nation’s energy sector. Meanwhile, OPEC+ stuck with plans to pause supply hikes in the first quarter. Bloomberg’s Rong Wei Neo breaks down the situation and the impact on oil markets.
title: Oil Wavers as Traders Assess Venezuela Fallout

author: Baris Balci, Beril Akman
description: Turkish inflation slowed for the third month in a row, potentially allowing the central bank to maintain its downward interest-rate path in the new year.
title: Turkey Inflation Slowed at Year-End, Supporting Rate Cuts

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thailand plans to review its inflation basket as the country’s central bank observed persistently low figures don’t reflect elevated costs of living.
title: Thailand to Review CPI Seen Misaligned With Household Costs

author: Yian Lee, Cindy Wang
description: Taiwan officials see Donald Trump’s capture of Venezuela’s leader as a powerful deterrent to Beijing’s aggression and timely reminder of the US ability to defeat militaries equipped with Chinese-made weapons.
title: Taiwan Sees Trump’s Arrest of Maduro as Helpful in Deterring Xi

author: Cao Ban
description: Vietnam ordered Netflix to remove Chinese television series Shine on Me from its streaming platform in the country over images depicting a map that Beijing uses to stake contested territorial claims in the South China Sea.
title: Netflix Withdraws Chinese Drama in Vietnam Over Nine-Dash Line Map

author: Suvashree Ghosh, Sidhartha Shukla
description: Bitcoin hit a three-week high in early Asia trading, as political uncertainty continues after the US move to oust Venezuela’s president Nicolás Maduro over the weekend.
title: Bitcoin Climbs to Three-Week High After US Captures Maduro

author: Eric Martin
description: The Trump administration is taking early steps that would allow for the reopening of the American embassy in Venezuela as the US looks to influence policy under new acting President Delcy Rodríguez.
title: US Taking Early Steps to Prepare for Venezuela Embassy Reopening

author: Bob Van Voris, Myles Miller
description: Nicolás Maduro will have already spent more than 24 hours in one of the toughest US jails when he appears in court Monday to face charges that could keep him behind bars for the rest of his life.
title: Maduro’s Journey From Palace to Brooklyn Jail Moves to US Court

author: Monique Mulima
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney spoke with Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado Sunday and said his government supports “a peaceful, Venezuelan-led transition of power.”
title: Carney Stresses Venezuela’s Sovereignty After Call With Machado

author: Catherine Lucey, Maria Paula Mijares Torres
description: President Donald Trump said the US needs “total access” to Venezuela as questions mount about the country’s leadership following the capture of President Nicolás Maduro.
title: Trump Says US Needs ‘Total Access’ to Post-Maduro Venezuela

author: Derek Wallbank, Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump warned other drug-producing nations in the Western Hemisphere that he wouldn’t long tolerate the flow of illegal substances to the US.
title: Trump Warns Colombia in Threat to Other Drug-Producing Countries

author: Kevin Whitelaw
description: Delcy Rodríguez, the acting president of Venezuela, invited the US to work with her country on a “cooperation agenda,” following the capture of President Nicolas Maduro.
title: Venezuela’s Rodriguez Asks US to Cooperate After Maduro Raid

author: Courtney Subramanian, Kate Sullivan, Fiona MacDonald, Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Philip Heijmans
description: After striking Venezuela, the US president signaled he’ll apply his foreign policy approach elsewhere, speculating about Cuba and Greenland as places he wants to “help.”
title: Trump’s Ouster of Maduro Shows America’s New World Order Is Here

author: Lucia Kassai, Jennifer A Dlouhy, Robert Tuttle
description: Realizing President Donald Trump’s plan for a US-led revival of Venezuela’s beleaguered oil industry could be a years-long and challenging process costing upwards of $100 billion.
title: Trump’s Venezuela Oil Revival Plan Is a $100 Billion Gamble

author: Ellen Milligan
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he will pursue greater access to the European Union’s single market, setting up a political fight with Nigel Farage that he hopes will help turn his government’s fortune around this year.
title: Starmer Sets Up Fight With Farage on EU Single Market Access
